channel.title: Using animated GIF on a client background
channel.description:
I was told it's posible, but i'm not sure how, my current method for the background ( the one used by most clients ) shows one frame. Any clue if pixelgrabber even works for animated images?
I'm googling as well but I want some insight from people here as well.

item.title: Using animated GIF on a client background
item.dc:creator: @hippie hippie
item.description:
@hippie wrote:

This is the method we are concearnd with.

 public Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(byte abyte0[], Component component)
    {
        aBoolean1428 = false;
        anInt1429 = 24869;
        anInt1431 = -32357;
        aByte1432 = 3;
        aBoolean1433 = false;
        anInt1434 = -388;
        aBoolean1435 = false;
        aBoolean1436 = true;
        aBoolean1437 = true;
        aBoolean1438 = false;
        try
        {
            Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(("test.gif"));
            MediaTracker mediatracker = new MediaTracker(component);
            mediatracker.addImage(image, 0);
            mediatracker.waitForAll();
            anInt1440 = image.getWidth(component);
            anInt1441 = image.getHeight(component);
            anInt1444 = anInt1440;
            anInt1445 = anInt1441;
            anInt1442 = 0;
            anInt1443 = 0;
            anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
            PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
            pixelgrabber.grabPixels();
            return;
        }
        catch(Exception _ex)
        {
            System.out.println("Error converting jpg");
        }
    }

Ill upload the image if need be, ill bbs though, lunch.

Read full topic
item.source: Using animated GIF on a client background

item.title: Using animated GIF on a client background
item.dc:creator: @adamp40 adamp40
item.description:
@adamp40 wrote:

I think that you need to change the conversion…

On class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.class it converts the .png to a .jpg

I think if you change this it will work…?

Read full topic
